titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Frank A. Golder papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ronald Bulatoff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-03-13T10:34-0700

change.item: March 12, 2018: Revised to include microfilm reel numbers in the container instances. Box/Folder info moved to item level scope and contents note. - Paige Davenport
revised to add new description for 31.6 from Ed Kasinec
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi
Revised from rehousing box 37, folders 6-8 expanded. Code updated to OAC standards
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Frank Alfred Golder Papers)//EN" "reg_093.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, diaries, memoranda, transcripts of documents from Russian archives, printed matter, and photographs, relating to Russian history in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, the Russian American Company in Alaska, conditions in Russia during the Russian Revolution and Civil War, and American Relief Administration work in Russia.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 1-38 closed. Microfilm use copy available. The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Frank Alfred Golder papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Odessa, Russia
Arrived in the United States
Ph.B., Bucknell University
Teacher in U.S. public schools in Alaska the Aleutian Islands
M.A., Harvard University
Studied in Berlin, Paris and St. Petersburg
Instructor in history, University of Missouri

eventgrp.event: Instructor in history and economics, Boston University

chronitem.event: Instructor of history, University of Chicago
Assistant professor of history, Washington State College
Author, Russian Expansion on the Pacific
Professor of history, Washington State College

eventgrp.event: Author, <title render="italic">Guide To Materials for American History in Russian Archives</title>
Conducted research in Russian archives for Carnegie Institute and American Geographical Society

chronitem.event: Member, Colonel House Commission of Inquiry
Author, The Russian Revolution
Member, American Relief Administration
Associate Professor and Professor of history, Stanford University
Author, Bering's Voyages
Author, History of Russia
Author, Documents of Russian History, On the Trail of the Russian Famine and Paul Jones in Russia
Author, March of the Mormon Battalion
Died, Stanford, California

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, diaries, memoranda, transcripts of documents from Russian archives, printed matter, and photographs, relating to Russian history in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, the Russian American Company in Alaska, conditions in Russia during the Russian Revolution and Civil War, and American Relief Administration work in Russia.

item.extref: Downloadable PDF file of the Microfilm Reel Content Guide

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, certificates, clippings, appointment books, bibliographies, printed matter, relating to the career and life of F. Golder. Arranged alphabetically by physical form.

did.unittitle: Clipping, "Dr. Golder in Finland, 1920," Helsingin Sanomat,
Teaching material, Stanford University, History 14, introductory seminar,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten and typewritten diaries arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten, typewritten, and printed copies of speeches and writings by F. Golder with related correspondence, notes and research materials. Arranged chronologically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten and typewritten transcriptions, by F. Golder, of archival materials for the period before, during and after the Russian Revolution, from various repositories. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, essays, notes, and printed matter, relating to the operations of the American Relief Adminstration in Europe, the Near East and Russia. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, clippings, lists, notes, transcripts, printed matter and miscellany. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 124 prints. Includes photographs of Frank Golder; American Relief Administration, European and Russian Operations, staff; conditions and victims of the famine in Russia, 1921-1923; cannibalism in Russia during the famine, 1921-1923; various scenes in Russia; various scenes in Latvia, primarily Kovno. Arranged by subject.
